intro: Asperula savranica, commonly known as the Savran bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine layer of white pubescence. Asperula savranica prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant for rock gardens and borders.
